interestingcomments.content:
Selling my Mint M6TTL (0.72) /!/ $2700, or best offer! + 3% PayPal Fees, and $40 shipping
    
Mint condition Leica M6TTL Silver (0.72)    
With original box, original case, strap, papers    
    
Bought from a photo teacher who had it as a back-up.  He shot with a M4, and he never touched this M6TTL ever.  He sold it to me 6 months ago, and I shot < 10 rolls through it. 

Light meter, TTL, film advance, work perfectly and crisply, absolutely mint and like NEW.    

Selling because I recently bought a 28mm Summilux, and another M6TTL but 0.58 magnification.    

Need cash, make me a best offer.

interestingcomments.content:
Clarification on micro-contrast, character, and lens IQ. /!/ I am really getting deep into the rabbit hole of lens/glass quality and figured this is a good place to post this.

I am somewhat mystified about older/vintage lenses and lenses with very high price tags and what people say about that glass.

So what do you guys think about micro-contrast, character, and lens IQ?

Is micro-contrast part of lens IQ, does it connect to character, is the character of a lens just how certain flaws in it's design make the image it produces look interesting, is this why many people fall in love with vintage glass, are these high priced lenses (cooke, zeiss, leica, etc.) really giving some extra etherial substance to their image beyond lens IQ????

Any input would highly appriciated.
